c74object.name: bach.pack
c74object.digest: Assemble an llll with keyed sublists
c74object.description: Assembles an llll to be parsed by bach.keys.

inlet.digest: llll to become a keyed sublist

objarg.name: keys
objarg.description: The keys to prepend to each incoming llll. If a key is set to null, nothing will be prepended and the incoming llll will be simply wrapped and prepended to the output llll.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang will cause the assembled llll to be output.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Add the key to the llll
method.description: The key specified for the inlet will be prepended to the llll, and the llll will be joined to the others, according to the position of the inlet. If a null is received and the nullmode attribute is set to 1, the corresponding sublist will not be added to the output llll. If the inlet is marked as "hot" by the triggers attribute, the resulting llll is output.

attribute.name: nullmode
attribute.description: When set to 1, an empty inlet will not concour to the formation of the output llll.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: triggers
attribute.description: A list setting which inlets are "hot" (i.e., which will will trigger the result). -1 means all inlets are hot. No arguments mean all inlets are cold. Default is 1.

entry.name: Inlets 1, 2, 3... (llll)
entry.description: llll to become a keyed sublist.
